Any suggestions on how to modify the mounting plate to get motors inside of frame?

Can you share some pictures? Ideally with a ruler or tape measure in frame?

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":6,"updated_at":"2025-02-13T18:28:57.448Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":175,"readers_count":174,"score":35.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":491566,"topic_slug":"neo-motor-outside-of-frame-perimeter-when-mounted-on-thrify-bot-2-stage-elevator","display_username":"Skye Leake","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":true,"admin":false,"staff":true,"user_id":19235,"hidden":false,"trust_level":4,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Pretengineer"},"post_url":"/t/neo-motor-outside-of-frame-perimeter-when-mounted-on-thrify-bot-2-stage-elevator/491566/2","custom_user_title":"Pretengineer","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3526275,"name":"Brendan Simons, 5406","username":"nuclearnerd","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/nuclearnerd/{size}/7324_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-13T18:35:52.294Z","cooked":"

The “stock” TTB design needs a lot of space on either side of the elevator for the Max Planetaries.

image406×901 76.8 KB

If you don’t have that space, I recommend:

  • Use a Rev Max 90 or Max 180 gearbox, either before or after the planetary gearboxes to flip the motors away from the frame perimeter.
    • note - if you use either of these before the planetary, you’ll need the 1/2" hex input coupler. Annoyingly, I can’t find this part for sale on the US Rev website anymore?
  • Use some Max Pattern Tube and a belt or chain to move the motor away from the bottom of the elevator as Rev did with their 2025 “Starter Bot”
    image701×632 120 KB

2358 - Robot Repairman (Mentor)","username":"Case0823","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/case0823/{size}/142471_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-13T18:43:35.947Z","cooked":"

I second the Max 90 degree gear boxes for this. We’ve used them a couple times now to keep large gearbox assemblies from sticking out of the frame, hanging so far off a structural member into space, and to just make the packaging nicer.

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":6,"updated_at":"2025-02-13T18:43:35.947Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":148,"readers_count":147,"score":44.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":491566,"topic_slug":"neo-motor-outside-of-frame-perimeter-when-mounted-on-thrify-bot-2-stage-elevator","display_username":"Casey Stahl - 2358 - Robot Repairman (Mentor)","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":26539,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/neo-motor-outside-of-frame-perimeter-when-mounted-on-thrify-bot-2-stage-elevator/491566/4","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3526318,"name":"jrz126","username":"jrz126","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/j/e36b37/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-02-13T19:10:21.856Z","cooked":"

How far outside? Ours was only 0.29" over on each side according to CAD model. Shifted the motors in by 1 hole. Right side cleared with no issue. Left side gearbox interfered with the elevator bearing.

Solution was to clearance the one mounting hole on the gearbox.

image1725×844 124 KB

Was painful grinding up a new gearbox, but simpler/cheaper than adding another stage. Wrapped the bearings in masking tape to keep the shavings out of the bearings

nuclearnerd:

Max 180 gearbox

Huh, I must have missed (or forgotten about) this product launch… Definitley something I’ll need to remember for future designs!
